Description: Medium sized axe head made of greyish-black basalt, rectangular shape tapered towards the butt, convex at the blade end. The front side is smoothed the area near the blade is polished, the back side is rough. A small area at the blade end is chipped off from using the object. The blade is well smoothed and sharp. The section is convex, slightly tapered towards the blade.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13, south-west corner of the square, surface
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 234)
